Wir suchen einen engagierten und motivierten Network Engineer zur Verstärkung des Teams Network Engineering mit einer Passion für DevOps/DevNet.Your opportunityIn Ihrer Rolle treiben Sie die Automatisierung der Netzwerk-Infrastruktur weiter voran. Die dafür benötigten Werkzeuge werden mit Python, Ansible, und pyATS programmiert. Sie steigern damit die betriebliche Effizienz und unterstützen das Betriebsteam bei der täglichen Arbeit.Sie entwickeln bei uns im Team moderne, nachhaltige, sichere und skalierbare Netzwerkkonzepte und -lösungen.Ihre aktive Beteiligung bei Architekturthemen, Strategiefragen und insbesondere, wenn es um den Cyberschutz der Infrastruktur geht, ist willkommen.In der Laborumgebung entwickelte Lösungen begleiten Sie gemeinsam mit dem Betriebsteam bei der Überführung in die Produktion. Je nach Bedarf führen Sie interne Schulungen oder Workshops durch.Sie Dokumentieren Ihre Arbeit im Git Repository, in einfachen, verständlichen Visio-Zeichnungen und/oder Wiki-Dokumenten entsprechend unseren Qualitätsanforderungen.Im Rahmen der Sicherstellung des IT-Betriebs leisten Sie ca. alle 8 Wochen für eine Woche Pikettdienst.You bringSie bringen Erfahrung in der Automatisierung von Netzwerk-Infrastruktur mit (Python, REST API).Die Technologien Cisco ACI und SD-WAN sowie die Begriffe SDA und ISE sind Ihnen bekannt.Von Vorteil sind Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Anbindung/-Networking, Erfahrung mit Linux und Docker, mehrjährige Erfahrung als CCNP und/oder weitere Zertifizierungen wie Cisco DevNet Associate oder Professional.Als Ergänzung zum guten Teamspirit suchen wir eine kollegiale, offene und hilfsbereite Persönlichkeit.Unsere Firmensprachen sind Deutsch und Englisch.What we offerWir arbeiten nach agilen Prinzipien insbesondere in unserer Denkweise, Methoden und gegenseitigem Vertrauen.Wir bieten Ihnen ein modernes Umfeld, das technologisch auf dem neusten Stand ist.Wir unterstützen Sie in Ihrer beruflichen Weiterbildung z.B. Zertifizierungen wie Cisco DevNet Associate oder Professional.Neue Technologien werden bei uns geprüft, um das Wissen und Können im Network Engineering stetig zu erweitern.Wir arbeiten im Team und tauschen wertvolles Wissen und Können jederzeit miteinander aus.Unsere Arbeitskultur unterstützt den direkten abteilungsübergreifenden Kontakt und Informationsaustausch im Grossraumbüro und ermöglicht das Arbeiten im Homeoffice.Thank you for applying to Vontobel. We will carefully review your application and will respond to you in a timely manner.At Vontobel, we are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.We value the many voices within our teams and are committed to creating an environment where everyone who wants to be part of our performance culture can be themselves. It is based on mutual respect and zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.If you have any questions you can contact us through our contact form.

Caring for the world, one person at a time... inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.The person in this position will be accountable/ responsible for managing all EMEA supply chain activities for the product portfolio they will be assigned. The person in this role will demonstrate strong experience in supply chain in a regulated environment, collaboration skills and sense of urgency to ensure timely resolution of issues, as well as a continuous improvement mindset to develop strong processes to prevent further gaps in the future.This position will report to the EMEA CSS Supply Chain Lead.Main Responsibilities:Supports regional Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) process with marketing/sales and commercial finance to align market and financial requirements with manufacturing/Supply capabilities.Build product volume forecasts based on historical demand information (or statistical model) & Marketing intelligence (Phase in, phase out, future commercial insights) & product mix forecasts based on historical mix information and marketing information. Load, maintain and ensure integrity of product forecasts in E2E Planning System. Responsible for translation of Demand Plan into $ Revenue Plan in partnership with Finance.Identifies gaps between the latest financial plan and demand plan defining and driving actions to understand/reconcile key differences.Responsible to define and execute strategies to improve key business metrics inc. forecast accuracy & forecast error impacting customer service and inventory.Support key metrics: customer service, inventory metrics (gross/net dollars, DOS), and Slow Moving/Obsolete (SLOB) inventory, Back Order Value ($) & on time adherence to S&OP drumbeat - all in partnership with supply chain partners.Ensure strong alignment with global/regional/country partners on key S&OP touchpoints inc demand handoff processes.Participates into the New Product Introduction and Portfolio optimization processes owning key steps.Conduct scenario-based analyses to evaluate launch options and develop contingency plans.Participate in Supply Chain business planning processes, setting safety stock levels, running inventory tracking processes and reconciliation (i.e. actual vs. plan) and identifying/implementing inventory reduction opportunities.Support allocation policy definition with analyses as required and support analysis of exceptions. Perform the interplant DRP releases between main hub and distribution centers.Communicate on supply issues root cause, corrective action and full recovery date to marketing organization and management.Work with marketing/sales groups to make customer allocation decisions by analyzing historic demand, available supply and customer prioritization.Pro-actively recommend process / system improvements and manage implementation / change management. Projects, analysis & reporting, and other responsibilities as assigned by management.QualificationWho we are looking for:The demonstrated ability to identify problems/issues, recommend appropriate solutions, and follow-up to ensure positive results is required.Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to interpret large amounts of data is requiredExperience in planning, purchasing or materials management is preferred.Shown analytical/quantitative skills are required and must be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel VBA & Microsoft Powerpoint.Alteryx, PowerBI and/or SQL proficiency strongly preferred.Project management skills, with the ability to influence decision-making, work effectively, and implement solutions in a cross-functional, team environment required.MRP, APS, and/or ERP systems experience is preferred.Manugistics, JDE, or SAP experience is preferred.Strong communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills are required. Scenario planning experience preferredMust have a high level of personal initiative and ability to function autonomously with a strong ability to prioritize, self-confidence, and comfort with new and evolving situations and environments.Previous experience in healthcare industry with global players preferred.Six Sigma and/or LEAN Green Belt certification preferred.APICS certification preferred.This job based in Zug, Switzerland will initially be limited until 31st July 2023 with the option for an extension or a permanent employment. If you are interested in working for a globally leading health care company in a challenging role, then send us your application in English today!

JobDescription: Für unser Produktentwicklungsteam "Fuses" suchen wir eine innovative Persönlichkeit mit Freude an technologischen Herausforderungen im Bereich von elektrischen Schutz-Komponenten. Python, Minitab)QualifikationHöhere Ausbildung (FH, ETH oder vergleichbar) im Bereich Elektrotechnik, Physik oder FGErfahrung in der Entwicklung vorteilhaft, vorzugsweise im Bereich elektrische KomponentenFreude an interdisziplinären Aufgabenstellungen und multidisziplinäres Verständnis von Thermodynamik, Materialwissenschaft, und ElektromagnetismusSie bringen ihre Lösungen gerne direkt in die Produktion, pflegen kurze Wege mit den wichtigsten Schnittstellen und haben eine praxisorientierte Macher-Mentalität Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute EnglischkenntnisseFreude an der Präsentation von Zusammenhängen und Resultaten an die unterschiedlichen AnspruchsgruppenAngebotModernes internationales IndustrieunternehmenFortschrittliche ArbeitszeitmodelleErfolgsorientierte UnternehmenskulturEin Umfeld, in dem Sie Ihr Wissen in massgeblicher Weise einbringen könnenZusammenarbeit in einem interdisziplinären Team mit flachen HierarchienAttraktive Anstellungsbedingungen und umfassende Förderung unserer Mtiednitendienarbtne eSCHURTER ist als Schweizer Technologieunternehmen weltweit mit rund 2000 Mitarbeitenden erfolgreich tätig. Unsere Kunden sind globale Player aus Segmenten wie Automotive, Data & Communication, Medical, erneuerbare Energien oder Industrieelektronik. Ihnen bieten wir Lösungen für anspruchsvollste Anforderungen. In einem dynamischen Markt wachsen wir dank hoher Fachkompetenz, finanzieller Unabhängigkeit und ausserordentlicher Innovationskraft.Sind Sie die kreative und umsetzungsstarke Persönlichkeit, die unser erfahrenes Team ergänzt? Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche Position in einem internationalen Umfeld. Profitieren Sie von einem eingespielten und motivierten Team mitten in der Stadt Luzern. Senden Sie diese an Klicken und Email senden. Für weitere Auskünfte steht Ihnen Herr Dr. Romeo Bianchetti, Head Engineering Fuses, gerne zur Verfügung.

In the Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development Organisation, the client makes transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world's toughest unmet healthcare needs. They are united by their mission to transform science into medicines. Together, they create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where their talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.We are offering a unique opportunity to join the team of our client in the Innovation Center Basel. This position is located in Lead Discovery, a department within the Therapeutic Modalities function, where the discovery of chemical starting points for further optimization in medicinal chemistry is a primary focus. They closely collaborate with their therapeutic areas and functions to convert hypotheses into innovative therapeutics.General Information:Start date: Asap / 01.11.2022End date: 6 months after startExtension: Is an option, depending on budget and performanceWorkplace: BaselWorkload:100%Fixed working hours: Flexible within regular working hoursIs a criminal record extract required? YesQualificationTasks & ResponsibilitiesYou are working on Protein Science aspects throughout the process from gene to protein with a particular focus on small scale protein production with mammalian expression systemsAs an individual contributor in a matrix organization, you are lab-based and work with automated small-scale expression and purification workflows for high throughput protein production and contribute to the continuous optimizationYou use your interest in lab automation to contribute to the continuous optimization of theestablished workflows from cell culture to protein analytics and data handlingQualificationMust Haves:Apprenticeship or University Degree (Bachelor, Master, PhD) in biology, biochemistry, biotechnology or similar with superior experience in state of the art recombinant protein expression systems, expression yield optimization and accompanying cell culture techniques Min. 3 years hands-on expertise in wet-lab work and in using different expression systems (bacterial, insect and mammalian systems) Knowledge in all major protein purification methodologies as well as protein-based experimental methods Good IT skills MS Office, Google SuiteVery good English orally and written is a must, German is a plusEfficient communicator with an aptitude for continuous learning, a solution-seeker with a sense of urgency to drive projects forwardIndependentDo not waste any minutes, apply now! We are looking forward to receiving your application.Please note that only candidates with a valid work permit or who are EU/EFTA citizens will be considered.

ROCKEN® ist ein Schweizer Unternehmen mit dem Sitz in Zürich. Wir haben eine webbasierte Online- Plattform zur Jobsuche und Talentgewinnung entwickelt, die den Bewerbungsprozess digitalisiert und die Unternehmung dabei unterstützt, Talente am Markt rasch zu erkennen und langfristig für sich zu gewinnen. Mit einem digitalen ROCKEN Profil kann sich jeder Bewerber schnell und unkompliziert mit marktführenden Firmen verbinden und das Profil teilen.Unsere Arbeit stellt technologisch und organisch die Menschen im Mittelpunkt. ROCKEN® bietet Executive- Search und Talent Management Beratung an, um die persönlichen und individuellen Ansprüche jedes Einzelnen abzuholen und diese in der Personalbeschaffung und Karriereplanung optimal umzusetzen.

Do you want to help us continue our success story? As part of an interdisciplinary, agile team that drives innovation at LGT, you have the opportunity to actively shape our digitalization strategy and thus our future. Over the next few years, we want to combine the best of the analog and digital worlds to create a truly personal client experience with cutting-edge digital services and products. As a Backend Developer for Access Rights, you are responsible for the development and maintenance of all access right topics in Avaloq an its interfaces to other systems. In this varied and responsible role, you will further develop the digital backbone of your specialist area and take on the following tasks:You design and implement changes out of requirements from projects and other requestsYou support other development teams regarding access right questionsYou take up the role of a access right specialist in projects You are a supporter for different agile teams in terms of access rights and work in these teams on request for a specific period of timeYou help to find a solution in case of a incident in the productive systemYour line team is mainly located in Bendern, Liechtenstein.The team in which you mainly work is located in Zurich and Liechtenstein, majority in close remote contact. Your daily and senior stakeholders are from various locations in APAC and Europe. You have a higher education in computer science or equivalent professional experienceYou have experience with Avaloq and its development suiteYou are familiar with Oracle database or know the principles of SQLYou feel confident with object-oriented programming languages like JavaYou are a flexible and resilient personalityYou work systematically, structured and independentlyYou are fluent in German and have a good command of EnglishWhat we offerOnce they're part of LGT, people usually stay with us for quite a while. This is because we foster a truly constructive and collaborative working environment and offer long-term development opportunities. We achieve success together and entrust you with great responsibility, offering an environment in which everybody can contribute and share expertise, help establish agile ways of working and bring in innovative ideas.

Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture.

Company DescriptionWriting the future. Together. Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow. By joining Avaloq, you’ll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. We consist of hundreds of Software Engineers, Architects, Product Owners and Cluster Leads and speak fluent agile – amongst many other languages. Our vision is clear – we want to code software that provides simplicity for a new era. And we think that we are quite good, at what we do, working with brilliant people on future-ready solutions every day. Our flat hierarchies enable each and every one to have a voice and we are always looking for new ones, helping us to become even more innovative. We have different teams looking for Android Developers (be it Engage, Mobile Banking or other teams) and look forward to drive our mission together with you. Your missionImplement, test, and technically document features of mobile banking solutionAnalyze and resolve software defectsEnsure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the mobile applicationUse various tool to develop the mobile banking solution for e-banking clients that uses Android devicesActively involved in the development process of our productsProactively find bugs in our products, document the steps to reproduce them, and provide a solutionQualificationsWhat you need At least 5 years of experience working with mobile application developmentClear understanding of the full mobile development life cycleHave published at least one Android appExperience working with Android SDK and remote data via REST and JSONExperience in native mobile application development (Java and Kotlin)Strong knowledge on third party libraries and APIExperience in Agile processesAnalytical, solution driven, keen to details, ability to work with a team, and above all has the passion to drive changeBachelor's/College Degree, Post Graduate Diploma / Master's Degree, Computer Science/Information Technology, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Science & Technology, Engineering (Electrical/Electronic), Engineering (Others) or equivalentAdditional InformationNow let's talk about perks and compensationWe offer high flexibility in regards to working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Software Engineer Automation / IoTStandort UzwilFestanstellung, 100%Start: Nach Vereinbarung / ab sofortTäglich kommen Milliarden Menschen mit Technologien von Bühler in Berührung, um ihre Grundbedürfnisse an Lebensmitteln und Mobilität zu erfüllen. Dafür entwickeln wir optimale Prozesslösungen, die jeweils die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette abdecken. Zwei Milliarden Menschen nehmen täglich Lebensmittel zu sich, die mit Anlagen von Bühler hergestellt wurden, und eine Milliarde Menschen fährt in Fahrzeugen, deren Teile mit unseren Maschinen gefertigt wurden. Angesichts dieser globalen Relevanz befinden wir uns in einer einzigartigen Position, um die globalen Herausforderungen in gute, nachhaltige Wirtschaftstätigkeiten zu transformieren. Safra Sarasin as a thought-leader in Sustainable Investments.ResponsibilitiesSector responsibility for identifying, analysing and quantifying material sustainability aspects.Writing company notes and thematic publications to better inform investment decisions and demonstrate thought-leadership. Caring for the world, one person at a time... inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. Within Consumer Health, the Global Plan Excellence (GPEx) organization is the owner of supply chain planning processes, data, architecture and metrics - driving continuous improvement, skill-set building of our planners through coaching, training, facilitating change and maintaining efficiency of process execution. Responsibilities cover all Global Consumer Health Planning processes, Master Data, metrics, reporting and analytics. Role Summary:As member of the Global Planning Excellence (GPEx) team in EMEA, the Business Process Analyst is responsible for maintaining and improving the maturity of core E2E planning processes by introducing innovative supply chain planning capabilities.Main scope includes Supply Network Planning, Product Lifecycle Management, Production Planning, Detailed Scheduling, Capacity Management and Material Requirements Planning.The Business Process Analyst (BPA) will act as Subject Matter Expert for key supply & production planning processes and systems, driving or supporting improvement projects and enhancements. He/she will drive and/or support the implementation of projects and smaller changes, based on the evolving business requirements. The BPA will act as SME for escalated process or system issues within his/her process scope. The BPS can get assignments on other planning processes or projects, as required.Main Responsibilities:Lead Project Activities to drive planning maturity Propose and support cross functional and planning projects, incl roll-out of Planning system enhancements & toolsSupport process design & coordinate the user requirements and mock-up definition with key usersPrepare and coordinate process walkthrough workshopsCreate and maintain detailed project schedule/trackerCoordinate and execute User Acceptance testing/scripting as required with the key user communityProvide gap and issue managementCreate training Plan and facilitate user training programCutover Planning and coordinationCoordinate Knowledge transfer, and lead Demo sessions to key usersBusiness SupportLeverage planning analytics and data; deploy a consistent set of tools and supply chain metrics to support business decisionsAct as Subject Matter Expert for the planning teams, providing expertise to resolve process issues when escalatedEscalation to Business Process Owner and IT as neededManage Communications to user community & managementTrainingLeads Change Management practices to ensure effective implementation and integration of process improvement initiativesLead and/or supports (key) user meetings to facilitate knowledge sharing and process improvementProvide trainings to (key) usersResponsible to ensure training content on enhancements / changes is in placeThis role works closely together with other ?Excellence' & ?Analytical' roles and specialized functional & IT-teams on technical set up and developments. The Process Analyst needs to be able to design processes and drive implementation on a detailed level.QualificationWho we are looking for:University Masters level with preference in Supply Chain, Operations, Engineering or equivalentOther certifications in areas of expertise desirable (Green Belt Certification/ FPX) Relevant planning experience, working in Supply or Production PlanningGood understanding of the supply & production planning processes and different functions in end-to-end supply chain requiredExperience with Planning Systems (e.g. SAP APO, JDA/Manugistics, OMP+, etc) and/or SAP ECC requiredExperience with Agile methodologies is preferredKnowledge of Databases, including query tools is highly preferred. Knowledge of SQL, R or other experience in digitization is helpfulExposure to FMCG industry is preferredProject management experience is preferredExperience with global and virtual teams is highly preferred APICS certification (CPIM, CFPIM or CIRM) preferredCreative & analytical problem-solving skillsBusiness fluent EnglishThis role based in Zug, Switzerland will initially be limited to approx. 10 months, with the option for extension or permanent contract may exist. If you are interested in working for a globally leading health care company in a challenging role, then send us your application in English today. Or give us a call if you have any questions!

Sonar’s industry-leading solution enables developers and development teams to write clean code and remediate existing code organically, so they can focus on the work they love and maximize the value they generate for businesses. Its open source and commercial solutions – SonarLint, SonarCloud, and SonarQube – support 29 programming languages. Trusted by more than 300,000 organizations globally, Sonar is considered integral to delivering better software.SonarCloud is an online service to eliminate bugs and vulnerabilities, and champion quality code in the software development process. It is already a standard product that extends Github, Bitbucket and Azure DevOps. Our goal is to make it the ultimate online automatic code analysis solution and get it adopted by millions of users for millions of projects and billions of lines of code.The team behind SonarCloud is looking for a talented developer passionate about turning SonarCloud into a cloud-native application. You will be part of an autonomous team without a manager. You will choose what to work on.The Impact you can haveThe team behind SonarCloud is composed of passionate developers who are progressively re-architecting SonarCloud to a pure cloud-native application composed of multiple services, in order to deliver great new features more fluently. By joining us, you will leverage your experience and expertise to bring SonarCloud to its next stage of evolution to delight our users and customers.This means implementing massively scalable services, automating all systems operations, measuring, and continuously improving the service quality. To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented Site Reliability Engineers.On a daily basis, you willEvolve and operate SonarCloudOperate our AWS Cloud InfrastructureMonitor and proactively maintain SonarCloud’s Service Levels (availability, scalability, and performance)React and own alerts, troubleshoot issues and incidentsAnalyze abnormal trends in SLI, or when SLO is breached and trigger actionsEnhance the monitoring and observability tools (CFN and CDK python) and own implementation of four golden signals across the SC platform (Latency, Traffic, Errors and Saturation)Collaborate with Cloud engineers, Developers, Release Engineers and Security OfficersHave a practical understanding of SonarCloud functionality and business processesMaintain operational documentationCommunicate with AWS Support for troubleshootingSupport the customer-facing support functionsFollow deploymentsPerform technical scheduled maintenanceBe able to react to high priority incidents 24/7Required Mindset and Soft SkillsYou are open-minded and have a very positive can-do attitudeYou take initiative and have the ability to lead a subject from beginning to endYou are comfortable with dealing with change and complexityYou are motivated by both functional and technical aspects of servicesYou are self-confident enough to challenge the status quo as well as receive feedbackYou enjoy troubleshooting and finding the root cause of issuesYou are comfortable with agile practices and principlesRequired Technical Skills and ExperienceYou have excellent engineering skills and good computer science fundamentalsYou have a production support experience of a cloud-native online platform You have a solid experience with AWS services: CloudWatch, CloudFormation, ECS, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, and moreWith an SRE mindset, you apply software engineering to observing and operating production You master a programming language, ideally, PythonOffice locationSonarSource is a company with offices in Geneva (Switzerland) and Annecy (France) and Bochum (Germany). The role can be based in either of these offices.How to perform during interviewsIf you want to have an overview of the hiring process and maximize your chances to pass, feel free to check our Interview Preparation Guide!Words from the TeamWe come from different backgrounds, and countries, and have diverse skills and personalities with a DevOps mindset. We are a group of 20+ people having fun at work. We build and run SonarCloud: together we are the SonarCloud team!Come as you are, and help us make SonarCloud better every day!Why you will love it hereSafe work culture:we value respect, kindness, and the right to fail.Flexible hours:we schedule our days in order to be effective at work, this is why some people prefer to work from home one day per week.Great people:we value people skills as much as technical skills and strive to keep things friendly and laid back. Still, that does not prevent us to be passionate leaders in our domains. Our 300+ SonarSourcers from 33 different nationalities can relate!Work-life balance:keeping a healthy work-life balance is important. This is why we have a hybrid work policy and some people prefer working some days from home.Always keep learning:in an ever-changing industry, learning new skills is a must, and we're happy to help our team to acquire them.What we doSonarSource was started by a team of developers that wanted to change the way code is built in an agile development process. The company was created to develop the open-source tool SonarQube, which is now the standard in code quality management with over 350,000 instances deployed today. Every day we are focused on solving developers’ next big problem.Who we areAt SonarSource we believe in people, excellence, and delivery. We’re a team of problem solvers and overachievers who seek out others who are also passionate and relentless in their respective missions. We want to work with people who are ready to fasten their seat belts and be part of an incredible ride. We work hard not because we’re told to, but because we genuinely love what we do and do what we love. If there’s one main message we want you to remember about us, it’s that we push others to be best in class at whatever they do: choose your battle, innovate, take risks, and lead change. Join us; we’ll be smarter and stronger together.

Kenntnisse in Python, PowerShell, C#.net, OpenShift und Public Cloud sind von Vorteil.Techniken wie DevOps oder Scrum sind Ihnen bekannt.Für die Ihnen übertragenen Themen übernehmen Sie die Verantwortung und treiben diese voran.Sie verfügen über gute schriftliche und mündliche Englischkenntnisse.Was uns auszeichnetLife-Balance ist uns wichtig. Wir bewegen und begeistern Menschen.Die AMAG Gruppe gehört zu den 50 grössten Schweizer Unternehmen. Unsere Vision ist es, uns zur führenden Anbieterin nachhaltiger individueller Mobilität zu entwickeln. Für dieses Ziel setzen sich die rund 6500 Mitarbeitenden jeden Tag mit grosser Kompetenz und Leidenschaft ein und sorgen dafür, dass unsere Kundinnen und Kunden jederzeit gut unterwegs sind.Die AMAG Informatik verantwortet mit ihren ca. 130 Mitarbeitenden für alle Konzernbereiche die gesamte IT-Wertschöpfungskette, vom Projekt über die Entwicklung und Integration bis hin zum Betrieb und Support.Connectivity, Autonomes Fahren, Car Sharing und Elektrifizierung verändern unsere Mobilität. In den nächsten 10 Jahren wird es mehr Veränderungen geben als in den letzten 100 Jahren zusammen. Unsere neue geschaffene Abteilung Data & Advanced Analytics begleitet diesen Wandel unter Verwendung innovativer Technologien wie Künstliche Intelligenz, Monte Carlo Simulationen, Optimierungsalgorithmen und RPA. Dabei verfügt die AMAG über einen einzigartigen Datenschatz rund um das Ökosystem Individualmobilität in der Schweiz - mit Daten aus Fahrzeugverkauf, Leasing, Garagen, Mietwagen und Car Sharing. Wir nutzen diesen Datenschatz, um mit Künstlicher Intelligenz und Machine Learning Prozesse zu automatisieren und um neue Erkenntnisse zu generieren - als Grundlage für bessere Business Entscheidungen.Data Science - wenn erfolgreich umgesetzt - ist mehr als Daten durch einen Algorithmus zu jagen. Es gilt, die richtigen Use Cases zu identifizieren, Stakeholder und Projekte zu managen, mit gesundem Menschenverstand zu agieren und mit visionärem Verstand den Wandel voranzutreiben.Zur Verstärkung suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine engagierte, fachlich bestens ausgewiesene und teamorientierte Persönlichkeit.Als Senior Data Scientist & Consultant stellst Du den Erfolg der Data Science Projekte sicher - als Projektmanager, Statistik-Sparringspartner - und als Data Science Coder.Werde Teil eines Teams, das etwas bewegen möchte. Diese Vakanz bietet die Möglichkeit, in einem hochqualifizierten Team an innovativen Themen zu arbeiten und Data Science in der Tiefe anzuwenden.

No.426180 - 100%Your main tasksBe a part in developing of cutting-edge, connected SmartDevicesAs a member of a Scrum team you will have a significant influence on the implementation of customer requirementsImplement and maintain features using C on embedded level (ARM microcontroller)Document and test according to specifications and ensure together with the team a high quality of the code baseSupport other teams of different disciplines with your knowledgeActively shape your work environment and take responsibilityYour profileSound knowledge in embedded software development (>3 years)Completed studies in the field of computer science/electrical engineering or comparable education/trainingFamiliar with agile working methods such as ScrumEnjoys the development of secure and hardware-related softwareMotivated to continuously develop and learn new technologiesIdeal toolbox: C/(C++), Python, Git, GTest, Azure DevOps, UMLExperience working in a regulated environment or willingness to learn the ropesVery good English skills, German is a benefit (team language is English, corporate language is mainly German)Your perspectiveWith us you will find interesting job content, promising development opportunities and attractive employment conditions. Ypsomed has its headquarters in Burgdorf, Switzerland, and operates a global network of manufacturing sites, subsidiaries and distributors. The Ypsomed Group employs around 1900 employees.

Hamilton Medical ist ein dynamisches, international erfolgreiches Medizintechnik-Unternehmen mit Sitz in Bonaduz, Schweiz. Unsere Leidenschaft ist die Beatmungstechnologie. Technologie, die das Klinikpersonal dabei unterstützt, das Leben kritisch kranker Patienten zu verbessern. Wir glauben, dass Innovation erforderlich ist, um den Anforderungen der Intensivpflege gerecht zu werden. Um unser multinationales Team zu verstärken, suchen wir in allen Bereichen laufend motivierte Mitarbeitende: vom Softwareentwickler bis zur medizinischen Fachfrau, von der Ingenieurin bis zum Exportfachmann, vom Produktionsmitarbeiter bis zur Regulatory Affairs Spezialistin und von der Projektleiterin bis zum Produktmanager.Aufgaben:Nach Einarbeitung in die Grundlagen der Beatmung und unserer Entwicklungstools spezifizieren, analysieren (Architektur und Design), entwickeln und testen Sie hardwarenahe Embedded Real-Time Software für Beatmungsgeräte unter Einbezug modernster Methoden (Modell Driven Development) und Werkzeuge (IBM Rhapsody, WindRiver VxWorks, Linux) in der Programmiersprache C++.Anforderungen:Um diese Aufgaben optimal zu lösen stellen wir uns Kandidaten vor, die ein abgeschlossenes Ingenieurstudium (Uni / Fachhochschule) mit vertieften Kenntnissen in technischer Informatik mitbringen.Ausserdem verfügen Sie über C++ / UML- Kenntnisse im Embedded Umfeld und sind motiviert, diese einzusetzen und auszubauen. Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse setzen wir voraus.Von Vorteil sind auch Erfahrungen:in der Programmierung von Micro Controller-Softwarein der Regelungstechnikmit Embedded Linux, RTOS oder VxWorksim der Erstellung und Durchführung von Software Tests auf verschiedenen Stufenim Einsatz der IBM Rhapsody Entwicklungsumgebungin Requirements Engineeringmit Cantata++ Unittestin Software Architektur und Designmit Matlab / SimulinkSind Sie interessiert? Dort finden Sie auch unsere Kontaktangaben für allfällige Rückfragen.Bewerbungen per Post oder per E-Mail können leider nicht berücksichtigt werden.

JobDescription: Caring for the world ... one person at a time inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. This culture of caring is the focus of our corporate philosophy, that is anchored in the internationally applicable Credo. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. We have more than 260 operating companies in more than 60 countries employing approximately 140,000 people.Janssen Vaccines, one of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, is a global biopharmaceutical company dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health. We do this by discovering, developing, manufacturing and marketing products that combat major threats to the health of people worldwide. The Bern site, with its approx. 600 people of over 25 nationalities, acts as a center of expertise for development and manufacturing of innovative cell based viral- and bacterial vaccines and bacterial based therapeutic products.The Analytical Development (AD) Department develops, transfers and validates various batch release, stability, in process and characterization test methods for our product portfolio. It performs characterization, comparability and stability studies and provides routine analytical support to the process development teams. The Associate Scientist position is located in the Process Development Analytical Services (PDAS) team within the AD Department. The focus of the position is to support the team in analytical transfer activities and assay implementation for routine testing within PDAS. The position holder will collaborate closely with AD scientists and analysts to ensure smooth transfer and timely delivery of analytical test results.Main Responsibilities:Work with viruses, cells, proteins and nucleic acids. From sample preparation to analysis and data treatment.Acceptance and coordination of all non-GMP samples Planning, coordination, and execution of analytical assays with focus on method transfer and routine testing in line with established procedures.Main techniques include cell culture/viral work (BSL2) and flow cytometry but can include additional analytical methods such as qPCR, ELISA, Octet, HPLC, cGE, SoloVPE and others Specialist of the electronic analysis order system of PDAS (eGondola) Close collaboration with local AD scientists and analysts and colleagues from the broader Janssen organizationSummarize and present experimental data to the team Adequate handling of notebooks and logbooks, regular update of lab databases and tracking systems.Create and review GLP documentation (study plans, assay protocols, work instructions, equipment instructions) in close consultation with AD scientistsSupport routine laboratory activities such as maintenance of equipment and instruments, ordering of materials and material stock managementFollow project plans including protocols, SOPs and work schedules in a self-sufficient mannerQualificationWho we are looking for:MSc degree in a life science discipline Work/research experience in relevant field Experience with cell culture/viral work and flow cytometry is major advantageIndependent way of working and taking ownership of assigned tasks to plan and deliver according to project timelinesTeam player with a communicative personality that can easily integrate into an existing team in a multicultural environment and efficiently collaborate Good organizational and planning skillsVery good communication in English, German is an advantageThis job based in Bern, Switzerland will initially be limited to approx. 12 months. If you are interested in working with a global leading pharmaceutical company in a dynamic, progressive, and collaborative environment, then send us your application today. Or give us a call if you have any questions!#diversity

DECTRIS is a successful and growing hightech company that develops and manufactures X-ray and electron cameras to spark scientific breakthroughs around the world. While photographic cameras capture visible light, DECTRIS cameras count individual X-ray photons and electrons. Our 130+ employees are located in Switzerland, the United States and Japan.At DECTRIS, academic research meets agile industry practices. The company's roots are deep in the scientific community and our scientists publish new research results every year. At the same time, our engineers, technicians, administrators, and commercial experts work hard to make sure our customers benefit from the latest technologies without delay.Our Vision is to provide the most reliable high-performance X-ray and electron detectors to scientists and radiologists all over the world.Our Mission is to enable scientific discoveries and advance human health by challenging the limits of detection technology.Your TasksIn a world where change is a constant, a continuous refinement of products and services is required. That is why DECTRIS is looking for a Software Developer Infrastructure. You will join a self-organised environment with an extremely motivated, highly cooperative team of software- and infrastructure developers.This team has an established and stable software product, which is able to test and qualify our detectors to our standards. Your role is accountable to ensure a sustainable growth in regards to scalability and observability of the infrastructure for our software products:Continuous development and operation of the infrastructure supporting our business processProvide tooling for an efficient development workflow in the team and beyondProvide an infrastructure centric view in code reviewsEvaluate new technologies and how they can improve our processes.Continuous collaboration with corporate IT department on company wide effortsTroubleshoot and resolve problems in production infrastructure (no on-call requirements in the team)Your SkillsFamiliarity with Linux administration and command line toolsProven experience with CI/CD toolscaleProficient in at least one high level programming language, such as Kotlin or PythonThe ability to identify, assess and integrate various open source technologies and cloud servicesExperience with Kubernetes and containersExperience with modern infrastructure monitoring solutions such as Grafana and PrometheusWe OfferA successful and growing high tech company in an international, scientific environment.Joining the global leader in HPC X-ray detectors for science and industry. Our engineers design cutting-edge detectors to support the state of the art science and technology.An international work environment formed by more than 130 experienced engineers, scientists and other professionals.An ambitious company with an outstanding collaborative culture, which commits to mutual success.Excellent, flexible working arrangements to enable professional development and personal life balance.A thoughtful environment. You will enjoy our modern infrastructure including additional benefits like a small gym, parking space, subsidised meals, free snacks and company events.Please send your application via email to Click to send email, to the attention of XXXX, with ID XXXX in the subject line. We look forward to meeting you.The Software TeamThe software team at DECTRIS develops the software and IT infrastructure required to operate and manufacture our detector systems. This includes all aspects regarding control and integration of our detector systems as well as the software side of the production systems for series production. Our goal is to always provide high-quality software in short cycles.3899914920000036Your managerMarkus Mathes, Head of Software Development

Your Expertise & Dedication make the difference. At Swiss Himmel we drive growth for our clients’ businesses and accelerate digital transformation. For the same reason we are looking for a Senior Java and Big Data developer Role to join us in Zurich.

• This is an exciting opportunity for someone interested in working in an international environment, while being able to interact with various stakeholders
• You'll be joining the organization as it's transforming its architecture, pushing forward with innovative solutions in various technologies
• Work with the latest technologies and share your technical expertise in a collaborative, agile and forward thinking team environment
Your Responsibilities Includes:
Treasury Domain:
• You are familiar working with applications in bank's treasury area supporting Liquidity and Funding as well as Asset and Liability Management lines of business.
• You have good understanding of control, regulatory requirements and optimize the capital, liquidity, funding and inter-group engagements across the bank and its legal entities.
• You define and execute transformation strategy with business team.
• You coordinate and consult with different teams such as business analysts, change management and IT to execute programs effectively.
• Coordinate with Business Stakeholders and Requirement Engineers to understand requirements and define the architectural model and high-level solution design.
• Implementation of required software components according to design specifications.
Digital and Data engineering:
•             You will create innovative digital and data engineering solutions and familiar using distributed processing engine frameworks.
•             Analyze and understand business and technical stories, writing code, implementing automated tests, contributing to release and iteration planning and developing the working practices of the team.
•             Capture detailed requirements based upon user interviews and system/data analysis and collaborate to refine user requirements though test-driven development (TDD).
•             Complete the unit testing of components for integration into larger subsystems.
•             Support the business in resolving high-priority defects and deploying fixes to production systems.
•             Perform code reviews and provide guidance/mentorship to junior developers.
•             Adopt DevOps principles with CI & CD implementation, Cloud Integration and Scaling.
•             Be part of an Agile Team involving cycle based development and delivery approach.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERTISE
•             Extensive Knowledge & working experience in bank's treasury area supporting Liquidity and Funding as well as Asset and Liability Management lines of business.
 •             Experience working with understanding of control and optimize the capital, liquidity, funding and inter-group engagements across the bank and its legal entities.
•             Deep Banking & financial service expertise with an intimate working knowledge of financial service customers specific application requirements, KPI’s (key performance indicator), and quality assurance goals.
•             10+ years of professional experience in financial services, driving design strategies, standardizing development tools, automation frameworks, and test processes to increase cost savings.
•             10+ years of Technical Expertise including Core Java, J2EE, REST API, Microservices, Spring framework, Spring boot, relational DBs, Hibernate, JPA, EJB.
•            Deep expertise in distributed processing frameworks/engines like Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Hive, impala.
•           You have worked with at least one Object Oriented language(as Java(Preferred), Scala , Python)
•          Ability to write complex SQLs for Data Base Validations and fine tuning complex queries.
•          Experience in Performance Optimization Techniques used in Spark.
•          Experience in using and debugging issues in reporting tool like OBIEE, Qlik.
•          Experience in Behavior-driven development (BDD) and Test-driven development (TDD) frameworks.
•            Hands-on experience delivering automation with a focus on continues integration/continuous deployment. (Git, Jenkins)
•            Provisioning of Automated Scripts in Docker Containers using OpenShift.
•            Skilled in designing high performance and high available applications, stepping into and turning around failing high risk projects, defining design strategies and project delivery plans, and managing system design and execution.
•             Hands-on development experience, familiar with a wide range of technologies, and managing and/or working directly with industry leading and open source languages and frameworks (e.g. Spark , python,  scala etc.)
•             Proven experience with Agile methodologies and Exposure to tools like JIRA, Confluence, Odyssey.
•             Good communication skills on all levels & Fluency in English
•             100% flexibility to work in different cities in Switzerland
•             Proven experience in working with global teams
•             Co-Ordination expertise with Onshore Offshore model

We offer
• A work culture focused on innovation and creating lasting value for our clients and employees
• Ongoing learning and training opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
• A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work directly with senior partners and clients
• A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture"

JobDescription: Kanton ZürichBildungsdirektionKantonsschule Zürcher UnterlandMittelschullehrperson mbA für Mathematik6080Die Kantonsschule Zürcher Unterland führt ein Lang- und ein Kurzgymnasium mit allen fünf im Kanton Zürich angebotenen Maturitätsprofilen sowie einem immersiven Klassenzug (Deutsch/Englisch). Mit über 1000 Schülerinnen und Schülern und rund 150 Lehrerinnen und Lehrern und 30 Mitarbeitenden in Verwaltung und Betrieb ist die Kantonsschule Zürcher Unterland eine der grossen Mittelschulen im Kanton Zürich.Ihre AufgabenAuf Schuljahresbeginn 2023/24 suchen wir eine Mittelschullehrperson mbA* für Mathematik für ein Pensum zwischen 60 und 80%.*mit besonderen Aufgaben: dies umfasst Ihren Einsatz im Rahmen der Klassen-, der Fachschafts- oder der Sammlungsführung sowie bei der Unterrichts- bzw. Schulentwicklung.Ihr ProfilSie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Fachstudium, d.h. einen Master in Mathematik und besitzen das Lehrdiplom Mathematik für Maturitätsschulen oder einen gleichwertigen Abschluss. Sie haben mehrjährige Lehrerfahrung auf der Gymnasialstufe und bringen bereits Erfahrung im Ausüben zusätzlicher Aufgaben im Schulbetrieb mit. Idealerweise sind Sie befähigt, das Fach Mathematik auch immersiv (in Englisch) zu unterrichten. Sie sind bereit, ein Pensum von mindestens 60% zu unterrichten.Unser AngebotWir bieten Ihnen ein vielseitiges und anspruchsvolles Arbeitsumfeld mit sympathischen Schülerinnen und Schülern und einer dynamischen Fachschaft. Die Entlöhnung erfolgt nach kantonalen Ansätzen. Ihre Bewerbung erwarten wir bis spätestens dem 11. September 2022. Der Eingang der Bewerbung wird per Mail bestätigt. JobDescription: Test Automation EngineerDu bist Test Automation Engineer. Und das aus Überzeugung. Du bist Perfektionist und gibst Dich nur mit der höchsten Qualität zufrieden? Doch nicht nur im Bereich Software, auch für Deinen persönlichen beruflichen Werdegang möchtest Du das Beste rausholen? Dabei ist Dir auch genügend Freizeit wichtig?Dann passt Du perfekt in unser Team! Denn wir wollen nicht nur unsere Kunden stets optimal unterstützen, sondern auch Dich. Wie? Mit vielfältigen Projekten, hervorragenden Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und einer idealen Work-Life-Balance. Damit Du Dich jederzeit wohl bei uns fühlst.Deshalb bieten wir Dir:Flexible ArbeitszeitenPersönliches EntwicklungsprogrammSmartphone-PauschaleMobilitätszuschussTeam- und Company-Events, die wirklich Spass machen!Weiterbildung und CoachingsWas Dich erwartet:Als echter Qualitäts-Experte bist Du vor allem unterstützend in automatisierten Testing-Umfeldern tätig. Konkret übernimmst Du die Konzeption, den Aufbau und die Bereitstellung der automatisierten Testumgebung. Aber auch das Erstellen von Testfällen auf Stufe Integrationstests, das Automatisieren der Testfälle und das automatisierte Ausführen der Testfälle sowie das entsprechende Tracking und Reporting der Resultate gehören zu Deinen Aufgaben. Zusätzlich führst Du Tool-Evaluationen in den Bereichen Test-Automatisierung und Testfall-Dokumentation durch. Du arbeitest jedoch nicht allein. Mit Deinem Fachwissen kannst Du Dich regelmässig mit den Entwicklern austauschen und dabei nicht nur ihre Sichtweise verstehen, sondern ihnen auch aktiv beim Reproduzieren und Beheben von Problemen unter die Arme greifen.Wenn Du Dich dazu bereit fühlst, unterstützt du sogar direkt unsere Kunden vor Ort in spannenden Projekten. Wir freuen uns darauf, gemeinsam mit Dir und Deiner Fachexpertise die hohen Anforderungen an Qualität, Systematik und Methodik unserer Kunden zu erfüllen - oder sogar zu übertreffen.Was Du mitbringst:Neben einem Hochschulabschluss (Uni, FH, HF), idealerweise in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik, konntest Du bereits mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung als Software Test Engineer sammeln. Dabei hast Du eine objektorientierte Programmiersprache (C#, Java, Python etc.) erlernt und "sprichst" sie fließend.Auch die Konfiguration von Continuous Integration Tools (z.B. Jenkins) sowie das Aufsetzen von Test Automation Frameworks (z.B. Selenium, Robot Framework, Cucumber) gehören zu Deinem Repertoire. Im Optimalfall verfügst Du sogar über eine ISTQB Foundation Level Zertifizierung und hast Erfahrung mit Docker Containern.Du weisst Deine "Testing"-Fähigkeiten sowohl auf klassische als auch auf agile Vorgehensweise einzusetzen und interagierst stufengerecht mit der Organisation des Kunden (Business und IT). Dabei willst Du dein vielfältiges Wissen nicht nur einbringen, sondern auch kontinuierlich in verschiedenen Disziplinen weiterentwickeln und Dich den Marktsituationen anpassen. Mit Deinem Kommunikationstalent und Deinem Teamgeist sorgst Du für ein produktives Umfeld im Büro sowie vor Ort beim Kunden. Neben verhandlungssicheren Deutschkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift fühlst Du Dich auch im Englischen wohl.Wer wir sind?Wir sind ERNI. Seit 1994 beraten und unterstützen wir Unternehmen in Innovation und Technologie mit dem Ziel, die unternehmerische Leistungsfähigkeit unserer Kunden zu steigern und damit den Weg ins digitale Morgen zu ebnen. Unser Schlüssel zum Erfolg: Menschen wie Du. Und unser von schweizerischen Werten geprägter Mindset. Wir wollen, dass unsere Kunden effektiver und innovativer sind als alle anderen. Gemeinsam erreichen wir diese hochgesteckten Ziele. Partnerschaftlich. Als echtes Team. Und mit echten Werten.Auf diese Weise gestalten wir Prozesse so einfach und smart wie möglich - mit rund 800 Mitarbeitenden an 18 Standorten in 8 Ländern. Und vielleicht schon bald auch mit Dir!Charlotte Sladek 058 268 12 00 Löwenstrasse 11, 8001 Zürich, Switzerland

Do you want to take ownership of Liquidity Risk reporting? Turn regulatory reports into actionable insights?As a member of the Risk Measurement & Analytics team you will be in charge of Liquidity Risk reporting and other regulatory reports such as capital adequacy, IRRBB or LER. You will own the reporting process end-to-end, i.e. from the interpretation of the relevant regulation all the way to the timely submission. Together with your peers both within the team and from business you will make sure that those reports are more than just a tick-the-box exercise but allow us to steer our business.Your opportunityBe the subject matter expert for Liquidity RiskAct as a sparring partner for business as well as within the risk departmentCompile and/or coordinate further regulatory reports such as Capital Adequacy, IRRBB or LERFurther development of reporting methods, tools and structuresProject work related to risk measurement and methodologyYou bringUniversity degree in Finance, Banking, Economics or related field with very strong quantitative backgroundAlternatively, a university degree in science (e.g. math, physics, quantitative finance, engineering) paired with relevant work experience in the financial industryIn depth know-how and experience with Liquidity RiskIdeally experience with other regulatory risk reporting such as Capital Adequacy, IRRBB or LERGood programming skills (particularly Python, PL/SQL)A flair for streamlined and automated processesGood command of written and spoken English, German is a plusYou areCurious and challenge the status quoPassionate about financial marketsA good fit for our diverse Risk Measurement & Analytics teamThank you for applying to Vontobel. We will carefully review your application and will respond to you in a timely manner.At Vontobel, we are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.We value the many voices within our teams and are committed to creating an environment where everyone who wants to be part of our performance culture can be themselves. It is based on mutual respect and zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.If you have any questions you can contact us through our contact form.

Hamilton Medical ist ein dynamisches, international erfolgreiches Medizintechnik-Unternehmen mit Sitz in Bonaduz, Schweiz. Unsere Leidenschaft ist die Beatmungstechnologie. Technologie, die das Klinikpersonal dabei unterstützt, das Leben kritisch kranker Patienten zu verbessern. Wir glauben, dass Innovation erforderlich ist, um den Anforderungen der Intensivpflege gerecht zu werden. Um unser multinationales Team zu verstärken, suchen wir in allen Bereichen laufend motivierte Mitarbeitende: vom Softwareentwickler bis zur medizinischen Fachfrau, von der Ingenieurin bis zum Exportfachmann, vom Produktionsmitarbeiter bis zur Regulatory Affairs Spezialistin und von der Projektleiterin bis zum Produktmanager.Aufgaben:Nach der Einarbeitung in die Grundlagen der Beatmung und unserer Entwicklungstools spezifizieren, analysieren (Architektur und Design), implementieren und testen Sie Software für das GUI unserer Beatmungsgeräte unter Einbezug modernster Methoden (Model Driven Development) und Werkzeuge (IBM Rhapsody, WindRiver VxWorks) in der Programmiersprache C++.Sie sind Teil eines grösseren Teams bestehend aus Mitarbeitern mit verschiedensten Hintergründen, Denkweisen und Expertisen. WindML Framework)mit dem Testing Framework Cantatain den Bereichen Software-Architektur und Requirements Engineeringim Einsatz der IBM Rhapsody Entwicklungsumgebungin der Koordination von Arbeiten zwischen Teams und einzelnen EntwicklernSind Sie interessiert? Wir bewegen und begeistern Menschen.Die AMAG Gruppe gehört zu den 50 grössten Schweizer Unternehmen. Unsere Vision ist es, uns zur führenden Anbieterin nachhaltiger individueller Mobilität zu entwickeln. Für dieses Ziel setzen sich die rund 6500 Mitarbeitenden jeden Tag mit grosser Kompetenz und Leidenschaft ein und sorgen dafür, dass unsere Kundinnen und Kunden jederzeit gut unterwegs sind.Die AMAG Informatik verantwortet mit ihren ca. 140 Mitarbeitenden für alle Konzernbereiche die gesamte IT-Wertschöpfungskette, von der Ideenentwicklung zum Projekt und Integration bis hin zum Betrieb und Support.Als erfahrener Business Analyst mit Expertise im Bereich Geschäftsprozessanalyse übernimmst du Verantwortung in spannenden und anspruchsvollen Projekten.Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams «Data & Advanced Analytics» suchen wir eine dynamische und organisationstarke Persönlichkeit als Business Analyst mit einem Schwerpunkt auf RPA. UnternehmensbeschreibungWir sind bereit Neues zu wagen. Bist du es auch?Syntegon Technology ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von Prozess- und Verpackungstechnik. Rund 6.000 Kolleginnen und Kollegen in mehr als 15 Ländern arbeiten für die Syntegon-Gruppe an intelligenten und nachhaltigen Technologien für die Pharma- und Nahrungsmittelindustrie.Die Syntegon Technology Services AG in Beringen (SH) ist ein Unternehmen der Syntegon-Gruppe und ein zentraler Baustein unserer globalen Service-Organisation. Mit rund 100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern stellen wir unseren Kunden ein umfassendes Serviceportfolio zur Verfügung, welches vom Support vor Ort bis zum Online-Service reicht und sorgen für den erfolgreichen Ausbau unseres Service-Geschäfts.Gehe den ersten Schritt! Bewirb dich jetzt!StellenbeschreibungIm Bereich Digital Solutions entwickelt Syntegon mit einem Team aus Software Entwicklern, Data Scientists und Solution Architects hochmoderne digitale Lösungen zur Verbesserung des Serviceangebots. Digitalisiere mit uns die Verpackungsindustrie und trage damit wesentlichen zum Erfolg von Syntegon bei.Du stellst eine zuverlässige, effiziente Datenanbindung vom lloT Edge Device über diverse Protokolle auf unsere PLC gesteuerten Maschinen sowie auch Sensoren sicher.Du übernimmst die Ausarbeitung und Implementierung des Backends und der API für die Benutzerinteraktion mit lloT Edge Device (Device Management).Gemeinsam mit dem Team arbeitest du an einer skalierbaren und zu einem hohen Grad automatisierten lloT Edge Device Lösung mit.Du erstellst Test-Szenarien und führst diese auch selbstständig durch.QualifikationenDu verfügst über eine abgeschlossene Lehre und eine Weiterbildung zum Techniker HF im Bereich Informatik oder Automatisierungstechnik.Du kannst Programmiererfahrung mit einer Hochsprache (z.B. C#, JavaScript) und der dazugehörigen persistenten Datenhaltung vorweisen.Grundkenntnisse in Docker und MOTT setzen wir voraus; Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment und IT-Security sind keine Fremdworte für dich.Du hast Interesse auf Maschinensteuerungen im Bereich der Datenschnittstelle zuzugreifen oder dir dies im Rahmen deiner Rolle anzueignen.Du zeichnest dich durch deine zielorientierte und fokussierte Arbeitsweise aus.Sichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden dein Profil ab.Zusätzliche InformationenStart: per sofort oder nach VereinbarungPensum: 100%Unbefristete AnstellungBenefitsProfitiere von unseren attraktiven Mitarbeiterangeboten in diversen Bereichen durch Corporate Benefits – lass Dich von einem bunten Angebot überraschen.Freu dich auf eine erstklassige Verpflegung in unserem Restaurant mit vielfältiger Auswahl und gesunden Ernährungsangeboten - bei uns ist für jeden Geschmack etwas dabei.Nutze unsere kostenfreien Parkmöglichkeiten sowie Ladestationen für Elektroautos oder eine gute Verkehrsanbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr - damit du entspannt in den Tag startest.KontaktJulia WachterTel: +41 58 674-6031Bei Syntegon am Standort Beringen sind wir über alle Hierarchiestufen hinweg per Du. Aus diesem Grund führen wir auch den Rekrutierungsprozess in der DU Form. Gerne kannst Du uns in deinen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit unseren Vornamen ansprechen.Syntegon ist ein globaler Arbeitgeber dem die Vielfalt im Unternehmen ein wichtiges Anliegen ist. Wir begrüßen ausdrücklich ein Umfeld, in dem alle Mitarbeitenden ungeachtet des Geschlechts, Alters, der Herkunft, der Religion, Behinderungen, sexueller Orientierung und geschlechtlicher Identität gleichwertig sind. Sofern in dieser Stellenanzeige ausschließlich die männliche Form verwendet wird, dient dies einer besseren Lesbarkeit und bezieht sich auf Personen jeglichen Geschlechts.

JobDescription: Meanquest (anciennement MTF Quadra) est une entreprise Suisse de services informatiques, spécialisée dans l'infrastructure IT, la sécurité les services managés, le cloud computing ou encore le placement de personnel. JobDescription: Do you want to help us continue our success story? As part of an interdisciplinary, agile team that drives innovation at LGT, you have the opportunity to actively shape our digitalization strategy and thus our future. Over the next few years, we want to combine the best of the analog and digital worlds to create a truly personal client experience with cutting-edge digital services and products. As a Backend Developer for Access Rights, you are responsible for the development and maintenance of all access right topics in Avaloq an its interfaces to other systems. In this varied and responsible role, you will further develop the digital backbone of your specialist area and take on the following tasks:You design and implement changes out of requirements from projects and other requestsYou support other development teams regarding access right questionsYou take up the role of a access right specialist in projects You are a supporter for different agile teams in terms of access rights and work in these teams on request for a specific period of timeYou help to find a solution in case of a incident in the productive systemYour line team is mainly located in Bendern, Liechtenstein.The team in which you mainly work is located in Zurich and Liechtenstein, majority in close remote contact. Your daily and senior stakeholders are from various locations in APAC and Europe. What you bringYou have a higher education in computer science or equivalent professional experienceYou have experience with Avaloq and its development suiteYou are familiar with Oracle database or know the principles of SQLYou feel confident with object-oriented programming languages like JavaYou are a flexible and resilient personalityYou work systematically, structured and independentlyYou are fluent in German and have a good command of EnglishWhat we offerOnce they're part of LGT, people usually stay with us for quite a while. This is because we foster a truly constructive and collaborative working environment and offer long-term development opportunities. We achieve success together and entrust you with great responsibility, offering an environment in which everybody can contribute and share expertise, help establish agile ways of working and bring in innovative ideas.
Möchten Sie beruflich Neuland betreten? Dann nehmen Sie Kurs auf spannende Herausforderungen – zusammen mit einer erfahrenen Crew. Herzlich willkommen bei der Luzerner Kantonalbank.

JobDescription: Eine Laufbahn in der Informatik bei der Suva ist weit mehr als eine sichere Arbeitsstelle. Bei uns arbeitest Du mit agilen Methoden (Scrum/SAFe) und übernimmst Verantwortung für wirkungsvolle User Stories. Und Du treibst mit unseren IT-Systemen und Applikationen die Digitalisierung für den Werkplatz Schweiz voran. Damit leistest Du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Sicherheit und Gesundheit der Schweiz bei Arbeit und Freizeit. Lass Dich überraschen und entwickle Dich mit uns.Junior Software Engineer Output Management 60-80 %Was Du bewegstDie Weiterentwicklung unserer Output Management Produkte (Serie M/ von kwsoft und Docugate von Leuchter), mit welchen wir die Erstellung unserer Geschäftskorrespondenz bestmöglich unterstützen sowie die Multikanalfähigkeit gewährleisten (Kundenportal, M2M, eBilling, E-Mail, Print, Archiv, etc.), bilden den Schwerpunkt Deiner Tätigkeit.Mit den neusten Technologien wie Springboot, OpenShift (Kubernetes), Tekton, Java und JavaScript leistest Du einen wichtigen und innovativen Beitrag zur stetigen Verbesserung unseres Output Management System (OMS) und hältst es fit für die Zukunft.Als Mitglied im agilen DevOps Team übernimmst Du Verantwortung für die Entwicklung ebenso wie für den Betrieb der OMS-Applikationen und -Services.Du gestaltest die Teamarbeit in der SAFe Organisation (Agile) mit, wobei Du dabei fachlich unterstützt und in Deiner Entwicklung begleitet wirst.Was wir erwartenOffenheit Neues zu lernen, gute Selbstorganisation und die Fähigkeit, Dich in einem heterogenen Team einzufügen.Freude und Begeisterung für die Fachthematik Output Management und die agile Arbeitsweise.Gute technische Grundlagen respektive erste Erfahrungen in der Software-Entwicklung mit Java (Springboot) und REST-Services; HTML, XML/XSLT und JavaScript erleichtern Dir den Einstieg.Erfahrungen mit Eclipse, IntelliJ, Git, JUnit, Kotlin und SQL-Datenbanken sowie Französisch- und Italienischkenntnisse sind ein Plus.Eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung in der Informatik oder in Aus-/Weiterbildung mit anderweitig erworbener Praxis in den oben aufgeführten Fachthemen und Fähigkeiten.Was uns auszeichnetLife-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.>> Jetzt bewerbenArbeitsort:LuzernSuva Frau Marion Lochbihler  Fluhmattstrasse 1 6004 LuzernTelefon 041 419 56 49

The PositionAt Roche, we believe it is urgent to deliver medical solutions now - even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about improving the lives of patients with brain diseases, and strive for ambitious ideas, innovative approaches and urgent action. Our belief is that our success as a company will come from developing therapies for patients in need, which is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.In Roches Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organisation (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world's toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.We provide a unique research environment with state-of-art genomics technologies and computational resources. Our team works in close collaboration with scientists in the disease areas of Oncology, Neuroscience, Rare Diseases, Ophthalmology, Infectious Diseases delivering cutting edge next generation sequencing solutions to support research projects.We are looking for a motivated and experienced scientist to join our team in the PS Genetics & Genomics chapter at Pharmaceutical Sciences who will oversee the development and execution of standardized genomic (next generation sequencing) services to support internal discovery research in pRED. You will be part of the BioX Genetics and Genomics group in Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS) function at Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED). We closely collaborate with our therapeutic areas and functions to convert hypotheses into innovative therapeutics and are currently ramping up our Next Generation Sequencing service capabilities to provide pRED wide support for internal discovery activities (eg, target identification, screenings, model characterization, etc) .Job MissionAs a Genomic Service manager, your tasks includes:Providing technical expertise in molecular biology and next generation sequencing applications (eg. RNA seq) across platforms.Analysis and interpretation of genomic data QC (including next generation sequencing data).Hands on execution of standard genomic workflows.Providing consultancy and experimental design support to internal genomic service customersAccountable for suitable sample storage and handling of DNA and RNA samples during analysis.Accountable for the correct maintenance of lab equipment and infrastructure, as well as for ensuring compliance with local requirementsApplying scientific rigor to ensure proper assay documentation and high quality (FAIR) data generation.Accountability for delivering genomic data on time and within forecasted budgetActivity prioritization to meet the portfolio needsDay to day team and activity managementHigh spirit of collaboration and ability to work in a highly self-managed manner in an agile matrix team with sense of urgency and ability to deal with complex situations.Training of other technicians and/or students.Your ProfileYou hold at minimum a Master in Science degree (or higher) in a relevant biological discipline preferentially along with experience in academic or industry setting.Proven record of molecular biology laboratory skills.Strong experience with Next-generation sequencing applications and sequencing data QCProblem solving and organizational skills are highly desirable.Familiarity with databases, tools, and resources commonly used in interpretation of genomic data is plus.People management experience is a plusFluency in spoken English and good communication and presentation skills are requiredQuality and customer oriented mindsetHigh spirit of collaboration and ability to work in a highly self-managed manner in an agile matrix team with a sense of urgency and ability to deal with complex situations.Our commitmentAre you ready to apply? Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.For non-EU / EFTA citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland (e.g. B-Permit, C-Permit) and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, Roche cannot guarantee your final employment due toauthority regulations.Who we areAt Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we've become one of the world's leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

You will therefore be able to work independently while benefiting from the expert advice of our experienced staff. You will contribute and actively participate in the development of our services.How you can make an impactThe chance to work in a team of experts in the area of audit and business processes and the opportunity to take over client facing projects in key industries Immersion in annual financial statements and special audits of our national and international clients within the banking industryA clear, long-term career path with a first-class training offer for professional development, including the support to qualify as Swiss certified public accountant. (https://www.expertsuisse.ch/fr-ch/expert-comptable-diplome)A young, international and diverse team with colleagues from over 50 countries A forward-looking workplace that gives you some flexibility in adapting your workflows to your needs (e.g. attractive benefit package or flexible working patterns; more on this can be found on our Website)Who we are looking for A bachelor's or master's degree in economics (specialising in accounting, finance or controlling would be advantageous) and previous internship experienceStrong interest in innovation and transformation (including but not limited to data analytics)Willingness to complete the education needed to become a Swiss CPA at ExpertsuisseCandidate must have analytical competencies, demonstrate logic and have inclination towards accounting and financeFluency in German and English. French would be a plusAn attitude that matches our core value: Be curious and courageous, respected and connectedYour team Become part of a diverse, multinational and highly motivated team at our Zurich office. We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes and on-the-job learning, but also by connecting with your colleagues across all business lines. Life at Deloitte As one of the leading global consulting and auditing companies, Deloitte is passionately committed to shaping the future. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. At Deloitte, you can make an impact that matters for our people, our clients and society. We offer an inclusive environment where you can grow your own way and build upon the purpose that drives you. You will benefit from flexible working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes and form lifelong connections in an international and dynamic environment. Qui sommes-nous ? :ACOMET SA est une entreprise basée à Collombey, en Valais (Suisse), spécialisée dans la conception, fabrication et pose de façades verre/métal et baies vitrées de grande taille. Ses équipes d’ingénieurs, dessinateurs et constructeurs métalliques s’appuient sur une connaissance de la physique du bâtiment et des matériaux. Ils disposent de surcroit d’outils informatiques et mécaniques à la pointe de la technologie.Engagé dans une démarche de développement et intégration de solutions digitales pour les processus de la gestion de projets, depuis l’appel d’offre, le calcul de coûts, l’adjudication, le suivi d’avancement et jusqu’à la facturation, ACOMET SA est à la recherche d’un software engineer qui contribue activement au développement des outils innovants tels que des applications web intégrées avec des bases de données dynamiques qui permettent d’accélérer, visualiser et optimiser les processus.Merci de nous faire parvenir votre candidature complète par mail à l’adresse suivante: Cliquer pour envoyer un emailWho we are ? :ACOMET SA is a company based in Collombey, Valais (Switzerland), specialized in the design, fabrication and installation of glass & metal facades and large windows. ACOMET’s engineers, designers and metal builders have a deep know-how of building physics and materials and have at their disposal state-of-the-art IT and mechanical tools.Engaged in an ambitious process of development and integration of digital solutions for project management processes, from the costs calculation, attribution and up to the project progress follow-up, ACOMET SA is looking for a software engineer that can actively contribute to the development of cutting-edge innovative tools to dynamically integrate web applications with SQL databases that enable acceleration, live-visualization, and continuous optimization of the processes currently in place.Please send us your full application by email to : Cliquer pour envoyer un email
